abstract: Supreme Court has reserved about 50 seats for members of the public hoping to sit in on oral arguments on whether gays and lesbians have a constitutionally protected right to marry; many have waited in line for days to get a glimpse of the historic deliberations, and some are even paying local companies offering to hold their place in line for a fee.
lead_paragraph: Same-sex marriage proponents traveled from near and far to be in Washington for the start of oral arguments before Supreme Court justices on Tuesday.

headline.main: Lining Up, Early, for Same-Sex Marriage Arguments at Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Toughest Ticket in Town, All to Hear People Argue

snippet: Same-sex marriage proponents traveled from near and far to be in Washington for the start of oral arguments before Supreme Court justices on Tuesday.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
